name: worthily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that deserves respect, admiration, or support: For the past four years, he worthily and bravely carried out his duty before his own people. It was a very bad move, however worthily made.
in a way that is not very interesting but should be admired for its good and useful qualities: He speaks worthily of his commitment to development. "Conscious rappers" are the ones who rap worthily about politics and black awareness. See
worthy
More examplesFewer examplesThese are negative qualities upon which nothing can worthily be built.She had to pretend that she had been spending her time worthily. Curtin's novel was first published in 1989 and is worthily republished this month.
